thread.title: Muhammad Ali's son detained, asked if he's a Muslim at airport
thread.title_full: Muhammad Ali's son detained, asked if he's a Muslim at airport

title: Muhammad Ali's son detained, asked if he's a Muslim at airport
text:
Muhammad Ali's son detained, asked if he's a Muslim at airport AP Filed on February 25, 2017 | Last updated on February 25, 2017 at 10.36 am Share 
(Photo via Facebook) He was born in the US and holds a US passport. A lawyer says the son of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport. Chris Mancini tells the Courier-Journal in Louisville, Kentucky that 44-year-old Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother Khalilah Camacho-Ali, the second wife of Muhammad Ali, arrived at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport on Feb. 7 after returning from Jamaica. Mancini says officials questioned Ali Jr. for nearly two hours, repeatedly asking him, "Where did you get your name from?" and "Are you Muslim?" Mancini says officials continued questioning Ali Jr. after acknowledging that he was Muslim. Ali Jr. was born in Philadelphia and holds a US passport. US Customs and Border Protection officials say they "cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the US are subject to CBP inspection." Share
